name: A Small Game About Juiceboxes
description:
"A Small Game About Juiceboxes" is, in fact, both a small game and about juiceboxes. Wield juicy abilities, zoom around to replenish your juice meter, and avoid inexplicable pink obstacles either solo or against friends in local multiplayer.

Features:   

  • An unwieldy title
  • Solo Mode (1 Player)
    • Aim to endure 10 levels of increasing difficulty or survive as long as possible
    • Shoot for a high score if that's your jam
  • Party Mode (2-4 Players)
    • Outlast your opponents on up to 10 stages
  • Achievements & unlockables
    • Unlock 15 achievements, 14 alternate juicebox (and non-juicebox) skins, as well as various stages for each mode
  • Gamepad support
  • Original sounds & music

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This project was developed using Godot Engine over a few months in quarantine. The game's current form is the end product of feature-creeping a sorta juicy platformer movement prototype thing I made -- hence, the (lack of) theming. It's my first somewhat-finished solo-developed game development project, so I'd really appreciate any feedback!

I'm planning on fixing bugs and tweaking content in this game probably through the end of the year. Since college has started up again, though, I'm releasing the current version with the intention of just getting something delivered before I get too overwhelmed with work. Hope it's at least somewhat entertaining in its current form!
